ratings.comment: Super easy.  Doesn't post powerpoints though, so you have to go to lectures.  Only 3 assignments the entire semester, 4 online open note- quizzes, 4 in class quizzes (dates listed in sylla), drop lowest quiz in each category and final is NOT cumulative.  don't buy a book, never used it. she's helpful and answers questions

EASY science credit! Take it.  Don't buy the book, write down all the notes.  With barely any effort you can do well in this class. I would seriously recommend.  Also, she won't answer your emails, but if you ask her something after or before class she is more than willing to help. TAKE THIS CLASS.

First of all, UW needs to change the course description of this class. It's heavy in GPS and modern-day mapping, which the description doesn't reflect. Anyhoo, i liked Burnicki enough. Lectures are boring, assignments are regular, but if you put in a little effort, you should walk away happy.

Lecture is NOT necessary, only go if you have a quiz. Find a different way to get the notes cause the notes are all you need to get an A. Don't buy the book. She always gives extra credit on hw/quizzes/exams. For exams just complete the study guide and read it over a few times and you're golden. Reallllllly easy science credit.

Very good, clear professor. Easy science credit. Go to lecture and study your notes. Readings not necessary unless you miss class. All tests straightforward. Frequent work (quizzes, assignments, etc.) but none of it hard.
This class is pretty easy. The tests, exams, and quizzes are all easy and you do not have to study too much. However, the assignments and quizzes are on a pretty regular basis.
Easiest prof. at UW thus far, take her class if you want to fulfill an easy science requirement.

Easy material. Burnicki is pretty funny and seems to care about teaching and not just her research (which is the exception at UW). Only problem: assignments/exams are not clearly worded and points are often marked off inconsistantly- so make sure and argue them back!

Ok I don't understand how people could not think this class was easy. Go to lecture, copy everything down, and all is well.  She's really nice and if you question her about where you got points marked off, she almost always gives them back. She's very helpful and straight forward, no tricks! there's also lots of extra credit!GREAT class for non-sci

She is the WORST professor I've ever had. The fact is, the modeling class could be useful and interesting...but her teaching style needs serious improvement. As the GIS adviser=even worse. Don't count on her to get back to your emails,EVER. She has no knowledge of the major or the changing requirements. She shouldn't be allowed to teach or advise.

I don't know how you can not do well in this class if you go to lecture. Her tests and quizzes are directly based off of lecture slides and the assignments are easy As. Random attendance checks for extra credit too. I'll agree that lecture can be boring, but just write everything down. At least she's kinda hot... oh, and don't bother with the book.

I don't know what people are talking about in terms of this class being easy. I found the exams and quizzes worded terribly and her lectures are EXTREMELY boring. She goes into detail about things like Infared and GIS, etc. This class was not what I thought it was going to be. DO NOT TAKE IT if you are are just looking to fill up your requirements.

Okay this Class is extremely Easy...I have no interest in mapping, but I wanted to take an easy class to get my GPA up for B-School...I'll admit sometimes the class get's a little boring, but just bring your laptop and take notes from the slides and screw around. She's helpful if you need it- She's got a sense of humor - Just come to class get an A

Very good class to fill a science requirement, especially for non-science majors.  All exams were based off lecture notes, so there is no need to read or even buy the textbook.  Only homework is 5 assignments that are not hard.  Exams are a breeze if you look at her study guide.  She's very helpful if you need it.  Highly recommend this class!

If you attend the class its not too hard to do well. Most everything is done in class with only 5 simple homeworks throughout. The exams were extremely easy if you just followed her study guide. Showing up is the toughest thing. You dont have to listen to her or read the book. Just copy the notes.
Burnicki is incredibly boring. This could be one of the worst professors in all of UW. Definitely not an easy class, highly suggest not taking.
Incredibly boring, reads right from the slides, repetitive, NOT an easy science credit
